alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend; Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 3:39PM CDT until May 19 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Cypress Creek Near Sharp Road affecting Fort Bend and Harris Counties. For the Cypress Creek...including Sharp Road...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cypress Creek Near Sharp Road. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 164.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM CDT Thursday was 165.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue a slow fall to 163.2 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 164.2 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 164.9 feet on 06/09/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (3pm CDT 05/18) Location Stg Stg Day/Time 9pm 3am 9am Cypress Creek Sharp Road 164.2 164.6 Thu 3 pm CDT 163.2 160.1 157.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM CDT.
